newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo corn futures end mostly limit-up.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo corn futures end mostly limit-up.

text.p: Tokyo corn futures surged on Friday, with most months closing up the daily 400 yen per tonne limit on heavy buying from local investors, traders said.
The benchmark January 1998 contract closed 400 yen higher at 14,620 yen per tonne. Spot March 1997 ended up 380 yen at 16,040.
All months surged from the opening, reflecting price gains on the CBOT overnight and the yen's fall against the dollar, traders said.
The buying accelerated in the afternoon session as some powerful investors covered short positions, they added.
On CBOT's Project A overnight electronic trading system, the spot December corn contract was traded at $2.66-1/2 per bushel at 0900 GMT, up from $2.66 at Thursday's close.
Spot January soybeans were at $7.07-1/4 per bushel, down from $7.07-3/4 at Thursday's close.
